titles.title: For the relief of Melissa Johnson.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 103-191.

calendar.text: Placed on the Private Calendar, Calendar No. 2.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 489.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 1/25/1993--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a specified sum to a named individual in full settlement of all claims against the United States arising out of the sexual assault and molestation of that individual by an employee of the U.S. Postal Service.
